deforestation_facts.fact: Deforestation contributes to approximately 10% of worldwide carbon emissions.
Every year, about 18 million acres (7.3 million hectares) of forest are lost.
The world's rainforests could completely vanish in a hundred years at the current rate of deforestation.
Deforestation is a key driver of species extinction in terrestrial habitats.
Logging, agriculture, and livestock ranching are the leading causes of forest destruction.
Forests are home to 80% of Earth's terrestrial biodiversity.
More than a quarter of modern medicines originate from tropical forest plants.
1.6 billion people rely on forests for their livelihoods, including 60 million indigenous peoples.

Forests play a critical role in mitigating climate change by acting as a carbon sink.
